title: Executive Order 6671-Withdrawal of Public Lands for Resurvey, Arizona
content: By virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me by the act of June 25, 1910 (ch. 421, 36 Stat. 847), as amended by the act of August 24, 1912 (ch. 369, 37 Stat. 497), and subject to the conditions therein expressed and to all valid existing rights, it is ordered that the public lands in township 12 north, range 3 east of the Gila and Salt River meridian, Arizona, be, and they are hereby, withdrawn from settlement, location, sale, or entry, pending a resurvey of said township under the act of March 3, 1909 (ch. 271, 35 Stat. 845).
This order shall continue in full force and effect unless and until revoked by the President or by act of Congress.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 6671-Withdrawal of Public Lands for Resurvey, Arizona Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/362436
